Must be able to assist developers to solve technical problems
Strong written and verbal communication skill
Good to have experience leading large & distributed group of developer
Must have experience working with internal stakeholders ( Product owners , End user , Senior Management )

Title: Software Architect
Job_Description:
We are looking for the right people — people who want to innovate, achieve, grow and lead. We attract and retain the best talent by investing in our employees and empowering them to develop themselves and their careers. Experience the challenges, rewards and opportunity of working for one of the world’s largest providers of products and services to the global energy industry.

HALLIBURTON

The Advanced Controls COE is Looking for You

Locations: Houston or Singapore

Responsibilities
Conducting research and development in modeling, control, and data analytics for solving challenging problems in the oil & gas industry
Contributing to the identification of high value problems and opportunities
Participating in control system design, control system prototyping, and implementation
Design smart systems to augment complex tasks
Collaborating with team members and providing necessary support for technology transfer
Publishing results in patent applications, technical journals, and conferences

Required Education and Skills
A PhD (or equivalent experience) from Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Computer Science, Chemical Engineering, or Electrical Engineering with a focus on Control Theory and Applications, Robotics, Mechatronics, Machine Learning, or Data Analytics.
Experience and strong interest in solving practical problems, from invention to implementation in the field
An excellent publication and patent record consistent with experience.
Extensive knowledge in control theory, such as modern control, adaptive control, robust control, nonlinear control, optimal control, Model Predictive Control, etc., with outstanding ability to identify the proper control method for solving practical control problems and, when necessary, to develop new control methods, and/or
Extensive knowledge and practical experience in the application of Data Analytics including machine learning techniques such as SVM, Neuro Network, Bayes network, Genetic Algorithms, etc., preferably with control applications, and/or
Knowledge of robotic systems with high DoF control, path planning, mechatronics, or dynamic modeling of complex systems
Demonstrated teamwork, strong communication skills, and collaborative in complex engineering projects.
Skills typically acquired through the completion of an undergraduate degree in Science, Engineering or similar discipline, and 2 years of related experience. Completion of a masters or PHD in Science or Engineering is preferred

Preferred Experiences
Worked with large data sets, unstructured data, structured data and supporting compute/cloud systems like Microsoft Azure
Built tools/workflows and support structures needed to analyze data, perform data cleaning, execute feature detection and extract business value from data
Developed models, control algorithms, workflows, & software for use in field operations.
Leveraged data visualization software applications, such as R, Power BI, Spotfire or Tableau

Title: Software Architect
Job_Description:
We are looking for the right people — people who want to innovate, achieve, grow and lead. We attract and retain the best talent by investing in our employees and empowering them to develop themselves and their careers. Experience the challenges, rewards and opportunity of working for one of the world’s largest providers of products and services to the global energy industry.

Overview:
Developing software for an upstream oil and gas industry can be very challenging due to various environments under which it has to work flawlessly. We are in the midst of our journey of digital transformation and automation of our services. We are looking for a highly talented and experienced software developer who can contribute in this exciting journey. In this position, you will apply your expertise to help shape technical vision and strategies that align with the business unit roadmap by identifying opportunities, providing solutions and solving business challenges. In this capacity, you will collaborate with other stakeholders to ensure the software being designed and developed is aligned with business requirements. You will be instrumental in helping facilitate the development of highly efficient, highly reliable, fault-tolerant scalable solutions to satisfy those objectives. Projects will be diverse and will directly affect the operation and effectiveness of field operations.


Under broad direction, applies skills to implementing leading edge software technologies and enhancing the Technical Software Development process
Conceives, proposes, and sells new ideas and products in the engineering organization and guides their implementation to a final product
Provides technical direction in area of specialty on major software products and services
Works on designs that span several groups at an enterprise level
Incumbent must be hands-on, be able to operate unsupervised and is called on to consult for the most complex design projects
May direct and monitor the work of other programming personnel across large scale development projects including involvement in design and milestone reviews
Coaches and mentors less senior developers and provides Technical Excellence Leadership
Must possess excellent communication skills
Skills typically acquired through the completion of an undergraduate degree in Computer Science or similar discipline, and 7 years of related experience or through 11 years of software development experience
Completion of a masters in Computer Science or similar discipline is preferred
Candidates having qualifications that exceed the minimum job requirements will receive consideration for higher-level roles give (1) their experience, (2) additional job requirements, and/or (3) business needs. Depending on education, experience, and skill level, a variety of job opportunities might be available Principal Engineer Software Development, Technical Advisor Software Development, up to the Technical Advisor Software Development
Strong experience with Microsoft .Net Framework (C#) and .NET Core for developing apps and services using Microsoft Visual Studio.
Experience in full-stack web development with Angular 2+, HTML5/CSS3/JavaScript and Bootstrap 3.x


Oil and Gas experience including drilling or geological related applications development
Demonstrated ability to stay current with Application Architecture best practices, design patterns, existing and emerging technologies and platforms, architectural and systems engineering trends
Broad technical expertise in the design and development of complex multi-tiered distributed engineering applications
Experience with cloud development (preferably Azure). Azure certification with AZ-305 (or equivalent) is a strong plus
Experience with event-based programming, microservices and use of containers
Experience with RDBMS including SQL. Experience using ORM tools such as Entity Framework
Familiar with using NoSQL database
Familiar with mobile app development
Strong Math background/Numerical Analysis experience with Scientific applications development
Job role contributes to value creation

Candidates having qualifications that exceed the minimum job requirements will receive consideration for higher-level roles give (1) their experience, (2) additional job requirements, and/or (3) business needs. Title: Embedded Systems Engineer
Job_Description:
We are looking for the right people — people who want to innovate, achieve, grow and lead. We attract and retain the best talent by investing in our employees and empowering them to develop themselves and their careers. Experience the challenges, rewards and opportunity of working for one of the world’s largest providers of products and services to the global energy industry.

Location: Duncan, OK preferred / Houston, TX Alternative

In this role, you will be responsible for the collaboration and interactions in the review of specific customer application(s) using electric technologies for the Low and Medium Voltage power systems for Halliburton’s Production Enhancement Product Service Lines (PSL). Also, you will support the delivery/commissioning of these state-of-the-art technology solutions for challenging applications in oil & gas to improve operational efficiency, lower costs and emissions, and maximize well productivity. You will need to be creative, dynamic, passionate, and data-driven with the ability to effectively communicate and influence the internal teams and/or customers to deliver best-in-class solutions. This is a high visibility position where the incumbent is expected to frequently interact with Technology, business leadership, and customers to formulate and plan technology delivery for electrical power systems applications.

Cultivate a culture of collaboration in the electrical low and medium voltage power systems to ensure that state-of-the-art technology is applied in the development of new customer technical solutions. Hands on experience in the development of applications of electrical equipment and systems including micro-grids, utility electrical interfaces, natural gas (NG) generators and turbines using industrial electrical distribution, medium voltage switchgear, transformers, motor control centers, AC motors, and protection systems for mobile applications. Actively collaborate with other personnel engaged in equipment design, maintenance, and operation to ensure safe, reliable deployment of high-performance solutions meeting customer requirements. Interact closely with suppliers to ensure performance, reliability and quality of components and subsystems.

Minimum of bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering with at least 5 years of electrical power systems engineering experience or related/applicable experience. Master’s degree is highly desired but not required. Experience working with customers in the use/application/selection of mobile electrical gear to solve customer specific solutions, and knowledgeable with electrical analysis and in the use of commercial software such as SKM preferred, or ETAP, etc., Experience in medium voltage power generation and/or distribution for oil & gas applications preferred. Experience with large-scale industrial processes (chemical, pharmaceutical, oil & gas refining) is essential to be successful in this role. Understanding of the commissioning of power systems solutions (low & medium voltage), using utility power, micro-grids, and mobile power generation (NG gas turbine & recip. engines), and demonstrated troubleshooting skills is desired, but not required.

Ability to read and interpret electrical and mechanical drawings and diagrams, electrical schematics, piping, and instrument drawings (P&IDs), flow charts and cause and effect diagrams.

Candidates having qualifications that exceed the minimum job requirements will receive consideration for higher-level roles given (1) their experience, (2) additional job requirements, and/or (3) business needs. Depending on education, experience, and skill level, a variety of job opportunities might be available.

Title: Embedded Systems Engineer
Job_Description:
We are looking for the right people — people who want to innovate, achieve, grow and lead. We attract and retain the best talent by investing in our employees and empowering them to develop themselves and their careers. Experience the challenges, rewards and opportunity of working for one of the world’s largest providers of products and services to the global energy industry.

Location: Houston, TX or Duncan, OK

Essential duties & responsibilities : Under broad direction, leads and direct others overseeing the development and tracking of technical information needed for decision making in multiple projects. Projects will be focused on hydraulic fracturing using electric power and/or other large-scale surface equipment technology for oilfield operations. Actively involved in strategic direction for technology development and involved from concept development through commercial implementation. Responsible for the system and major sub-system level design within integrated product team, including the implementation and design of heavy equipment, hardware, and software. Demonstrate expertise in a variety of field’s concepts, practices, and procedures. Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Advises on the development and monitoring of internal and external interface compatibility of the system and subsystems using an open systems approach. Establishes baselines and configuration controls for multiple projects. Develops and negotiates system level requirements and assist in financial analysis, ensures completion of technical and detailed product specifications, manages technical risks, and ensures product meets technical performance in a timely fashion.

A bachelor’s degree in a STEM field is required. However, a master’s degree in electrical, mechanical, or aerospace engineering is preferred with a minimum of 7-10 years’ experience in the oil and gas industry or other industries such as mining, industrial, chemical plants, and/or heavy equipment design. Master of Business Administration is desired, but not required. Demonstrated project management across functional groups, centers, and organizations, including creating projects in Enterprise Program Management tools (Microsoft Project, SAP). Experience managing projects charge outs, projects costs, and managing capital assets is desired, but not required. Experience interfacing closely with suppliers and/or customers on requirements, schedules, delivery costs/pricing and performance. Able to travel (40% +) to Manufacturing location (Duncan) and remote oil field location across US.

Education / Experience / Knowledge :
Skills acquired through the completion of an undergraduate degree in Electrical Engineering or similar discipline and 2 years of related experience. Completion of a master’s degree in Electrical Engineering or similar discipline is preferred.
Prefer Minimum of master’s degree (electrical, mechanical, chemical, or aerospace engineering) with 2 to 10 years control systems engineering experience or related/applicable experience.
Experience in oil & gas and power generation preferred. Experience in large-scale industrial processes (chemical, pharmaceutical, oil & gas refining) is essential to be successful in this role.
Strong experience with National Instruments Hardware cRIO, Sb-RIO, PXI, and Software - LabVIEW, TestStand, LabWindows. NI CLD or CLA is preferred but not required.
Proven experience in the development of advanced controls systems and Human Machine Interface (HMI) including National Instruments, PLC-based systems including model-based predictive and corrected parameter controls.
Strong background and experience in signal processing and analysis, control systems, system dynamics, and associated mathematics and computation.
Experience with system identification and estimation techniques.
Experience with data acquisition and measurement systems.


Ability to program in LabVIEW, Test Stand, LabWindows/CVI, Standard PLC Systems, Microsoft Visual Studio, C# and C++, VB.net, and Matlab/Simulink. NI CLD or CLA is preferred but not required.
Expertise implementing National Instrument cRIO, Siemens PCS7 and/or Allen Bradley control systems. Experience in other system platforms will be considered.
Ability to read and interpret electrical and mechanical drawings and diagrams, electrical schematics, piping and instrument drawings (P&IDs), flow charts and cause and effect diagrams.
Skills acquired through the completion of an undergraduate degree in Mechanical Engineering or similar discipline and 10 years of related experience. Title: Consultant - SRE Operations Team Lead
Job_Description:
We are looking for the right people — people who want to innovate, achieve, grow and lead. We attract and retain the best talent by investing in our employees and empowering them to develop themselves and their careers. Experience the challenges, rewards and opportunity of working for one of the world’s largest providers of products and services to the global energy industry.

Join the team building and running iEnergy® ‐ the world’s premier petrotechnical cloud environment. Landmark’s Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) team is responsible for architecting, engineering, operating, and securing the cutting‐edge, multi‐cloud iEnergy SaaS platform used to deliver Landmark and partner industry‐leading cloud solutions. Contribute to an environment where science, engineering, large‐scale cloud computing, and modern DevSecOps intersect.

As a member of SRE team, you will be entrusted with big challenges, working closely with development engineering in the DevSecOps organization, with regional technical engineers, Halliburton Information Technology engineers, and architects. Bring your expertise and curiosity to an environment offering unparalleled depth and breadth of exposure to today’s most relevant cloud technologies, DevSecOps practices, and petrotechnical science.

Overall description

The SRE Operations Team Lead is a business and operational leader with good working knowledge of Cloud Technologies and Services, DevSecOps, and SRE. Responsible for the Cloud Services availability, this leadership role has accountability for the Project Cloud organization with Architects, SREs and Domain Workflow Leads reporting into the role. Skills typically acquired through the completion of an undergraduate degree in Computer Science or similar discipline, Cloud Technology Certifications and 10+ years of Technology Services and/or development experience. The SRE Operations Team Lead is under broad direction from the Project Lead.

Must have leadership experience in multicultural environments and be able to work across business units, service lines, and organizations. Must be able to effectively communicate with customer and internal stakeholders at multiple organizational levels. Must take steps proactively to ensure continued availability and proper functioning of the systems. Must effectively manage a small, distributed team to monitor and respond to events. Must create and effectively manage the team’s schedules and work. Must work to drive down costs and lower total cost of operations. The SRE Operations Team Lead reports directly to the Services Organization with matrix report to the SRE Global Organization. A Technologist with experience running B2B Cloud, have scaled cloud operations and teams exponentially or want to be part of a rapid growing segment of the E&P digital market have a good fit into this role.

Accountable for the Cloud Services Service Level Agreements (SLA), Service Level Objectives (SLO), and associated m etrics. Provide Cloud operations management. Ensure Cloud Services availability. Successful Cloud services deployments. Work in close collaboration with Product Management, Engineering and SRE team to uphold and maintain integrity of cloud services deployments following iEnergy® standards. Responsible of continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines across software development lifecycle phases. Proactive monitoring and actioning of Cloud services alerts and incorporating new monitoring alerts as needed. Responsible for managing incidents with minimum Mean Time To Restore (MTTR) or as established in the Service Level Agreements/Objectives. Manage the On Call plan for the staff/teams. Provision resources. Plan and implement patching and upgrades. Analyze system health metrics for both real time monitoring and usability recommendations. Teams/Personnel Management. Support all aspects of employee life-cycle management including performance. Enforce best practices for security and reliability. Establish and follows SRE Principles. Job role contributes directly to customer value creation. Coordinate and manage the operational schedules and calendars for the team. Manage operational priorities for the team. Accountable to ensure the iEnergy® security standards. Enforce best practices for security and reliability. Follow iEnergy® operation processes (like Incident Management, Change Management, Root Cause Analysis, Patching and Upgrades, among others) and operational practices. Provide frequent reports as requested by the Services and SRE Organization.

Requires completion of an undergraduate degree in engineering, geoscience, computer science or business . 10+ years of experience in Technology Services. Experience with Public Cloud PaaS/SaaS solutions. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Experience managing a large global cloud organization working in multiple locations and time zones. Comfort presenting to and delivering projects for senior leaders. Displays industry thought leadership. Brings the best of the industry and the organization along in the journey. 3+ years of hands-on systems administration experience. Familiarity with broad set of basic sys admin, database and network tools. 1-2 years of experience as a leader or 1st level manager Prior experience leading or managing a 24x7 operations Good knowledge of Information Technology Infrastructure Library processes. A certification a plus Experience with one or more cloud providers. Azure or AWS preferred. Certifications a plus Experience with Public/Private Cloud Paas/SaaS solutions Experience managing Service Level Agreements, Service Level Objectives, and metrics An understanding of cloud reliability standards, observability, security, performance, disaster recovery and reporting requirements Experience with IT automation tools such as Jenkins Experience with setup and use of observability platforms such as New Relic Experience with IT and Cloud security standards and compliance SOC 2 knowledge / exposure Experience with open source distributed software systems is required Experience with cloud native technology such as Kubernetes is preferred Knowledge and experience with Landmark platform and application software a plus
Requires completion of an undergraduate degree in engineering, geoscience, computer science or business and a minimum of 3 years of experience with 8 years preferred.

Job_Description:
We are looking for the right people — people who want to innovate, achieve, grow and lead. HALLIBURTON

The Advanced Controls COE is Looking for You

Locations: Houston or Singapore

Responsibilities
Conducting research and development in modeling, control, and data analytics for solving challenging problems in the oil & gas industry
Contributing to the identification of high value problems and opportunities
Participating in control system design, control system prototyping, and implementation
Design smart systems to augment complex tasks
Collaborating with team members and providing necessary support for technology transfer
Publishing results in patent applications, technical journals, and conferences

Required Education and Skills
A PhD (or equivalent experience) from Mechanical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Computer Science, Chemical Engineering, or Electrical Engineering with a focus on Control Theory and Applications, Robotics, Mechatronics, Machine Learning, or Data Analytics.
Experience and strong interest in solving practical problems, from invention to implementation in the field
An excellent publication and patent record consistent with experience.
Extensive knowledge in control theory, such as modern control, adaptive control, robust control, nonlinear control, optimal control, Model Predictive Control, etc., with outstanding ability to identify the proper control method for solving practical control problems and, when necessary, to develop new control methods, and/or
Extensive knowledge and practical experience in the application of Data Analytics including machine learning techniques such as SVM, Neuro Network, Bayes network, Genetic Algorithms, etc., preferably with control applications, and/or
Knowledge of robotic systems with high DoF control, path planning, mechatronics, or dynamic modeling of complex systems
Demonstrated teamwork, strong communication skills, and collaborative in complex engineering projects.
Skills typically acquired through the completion of an undergraduate degree in Science, Engineering or similar discipline, and 2 years of related experience. Completion of a masters or PHD in Science or Engineering is preferred

Preferred Experiences
Worked with large data sets, unstructured data, structured data and supporting compute/cloud systems like Microsoft Azure
Built tools/workflows and support structures needed to analyze data, perform data cleaning, execute feature detection and extract business value from data
Developed models, control algorithms, workflows, & software for use in field operations.
Leveraged data visualization software applications, such as R, Power BI, Spotfire or Tableau
